hackerrank.interviewPrepKit.sorting

Class FraudActNotifCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • hackerrank.interviewPrepKit.sorting.FraudActNotifCalculator

  • public class FraudActNotifCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a simulation of solution for the hackerrank problem Fraudulent Activity Notifications.
    Author:
    praveen

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int MAXM_SPENT_DAYS
      The Maximum no of transactions(where each transaction is mapped to a single day) that can be picked for a calculations.
      static int MAXM_TRANSACT_RANGE
      This is actually the possible maximum length of the array passed in as a parameter of constructor of this class.
      static int MINM_SPENT_DAYS
      The Minimum no of transactions(where each transaction is mapped to a single day) that can be picked for a calculations.
      static int MINM_TRAIL_DAYS
      The minimum no of trailing days that can be picked by a bank for tracing, possibly the fraud transaction, for a user.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FraudActNotifCalculator(int trailDays, int[] expenditures)
      Allocates a newly created FraudActNotifCalculator which is responsible for doing all the calculations concerned with marking the fraud transactions.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int totFreqOfNotif()
      Returns a total no of times the concerned bank user will be notified about the fraudulent activity for the expenditures s/he spent.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • FraudActNotifCalculator

        public FraudActNotifCalculator(int trailDays,
                               int[] expenditures)
        Allocates a newly created FraudActNotifCalculator which is responsible for doing all the calculations concerned with marking the fraud transactions.
        Parameters:
        trailDays - The no of trailing days.
        expenditures - The transactions data on which calculations are performed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if trailDays and expenditures are out of the range allowed.

    • Method Detail

      • totFreqOfNotif

        public int totFreqOfNotif()
        Returns a total no of times the concerned bank user will be notified about the fraudulent activity for the expenditures s/he spent.
        Returns:
        Total no of times the user will be notified for possibility of fraud.
